alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 4:20PM MDT until April 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, At 21 Feet...the Milk River near Harlem is bankfull. Some minor problems can occur near the river from Chinook to east of Harlem. Impacts start to go up quickly as the stage goes above 21 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM MDT Tuesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 12.1 feet Friday, April 21. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.5 feet on May 11, 1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM MDT.
